ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.2_0: At that time, when the monks from the group of six knew that the Buddha had prohibited having blankets made entirely of black wool, they added just a little bit of white on the edge. In this way they had blankets made entirely of black wool.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.4_0: “How can the monks from the group of six act like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.5_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.6_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.9_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.10_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.11_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.12.1_0: ‘If a monk is having blankets made entirely of black wool, he can use two parts of white, and a third part of brown:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:1.13_0: If he has a new blanket made without using two parts of entirely black wool, a third part of white, and a fourth part of brown, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.2_0: newly made is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.4_0: it is made by strewing, not by weaving.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.6_0: is making or is having made.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.7_0: He should use two parts of entirely black wool:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.8_0: having weighed it, he should use two measures.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.13_0: Without using two parts of entirely black wool, a third part of white, and a fourth part of brown:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.14_0: If he makes it, or has it made, without using two measures of entirely black wool, one measure of white, and one measure of brown, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.15_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.16_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.17_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.19_0: ‘Venerables, this blanket which I had made without using two measures of entirely black wool, one measure of white, and one measure of brown, is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.20_0: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.23_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.24.1_0: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.25_0: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.26_0: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.27_0: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.28_0: If he makes one, or has one made, for someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.29_0: If she obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.30.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.31_0: if he makes one using one measure of white and one measure of brown;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.32_0: if he makes on using more than one measure of white and more than one measure of brown;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.33_0: if he makes one using just white and just brown;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.34_0: if she makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.36_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np13:2.37_0: The third rule, the training rule on two parts, is finished.
